Whereas the strategy of the away side was a bit risky and reliant on solid defending to dispossess the opponent and break fast.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Real Madrid edged out Deportivo La Coruna in a thrilling 3-2 encounter at the Santiago Bernabeu. From the first whistle to the dying moments of the match, it was a game that ebbed and flowed with moments of brilliance, crucial fouls, and decisive substitutions. The hosts emerged victorious after a pulsating contest, which had fans at the edge of their seats.

The first half began with Real Madrid kicking off, trying to assert their dominance straight from the whistle. However, just a few seconds into the action, Deportivo showed their intent as they committed a foul, resulting in an indirect free-kick for Real Madrid. In the initial stages, the game was frenetic with possession changing hands frequently, and both teams earning their share of free-kicks and throw-ins.

Real Madrid were increasingly seeing more of the ball, and in the 12th minute, Nacho found himself free inside the Deportivo box. He pulled the trigger, but his effort was brilliantly blocked by a Deportivo defender, leading to a corner for the home side. James Rodriguez took the corner, but the Deportivo defense stayed resolute and cleared the danger. Isco then danced his way past two defenders only to see his shot go well wide of the right post. Real Madrid continued to press, but Deportivo’s defense held strong, clearing numerous attacks and winning back possession.

In the 25th minute, Real Madrid had a great opportunity to break the deadlock. A foul by Celso Borges of Deportivo was deemed worthy of a yellow card. From the resulting free-kick just outside the box, Sergio Ramos's shot narrowly missed the target, going just over the crossbar. Another chance went begging, showcasing Madrid’s growing frustration in trying to find the elusive first goal.

As the half progressed, Deportivo too had their moments. They earned corners and free-kicks, with Emre Colak taking one such corner poorly cleared by Real Madrid. However, it was Real Madrid who looked more dangerous. James Rodriguez and Isco were constantly probing the Deportivo defense, with shots often getting blocked or saved by the goalkeeper, Przemyslaw Tyton.

In the latter stages of the first half, the game continued its stop-start pattern with numerous throw-ins, clearances, and offsides disrupting the flow of play. Real Madrid had several corners but failed to capitalize due to solid last-ditch defending by Deportivo. Both teams committed fouls, the most notable being Ryan Babel’s heavy challenge late on, for which he was booked. This combative and cautious approach ensured that the first half ended in a goalless draw.

The second half began with Deportivo kicking off. Real Madrid were quickly on the front foot, earning a throw-in within the first minute. Deportivo had their moments too, like the indirect free-kick they earned in the 3rd minute. A spell of possession saw Real Madrid trying to control the game, but Deportivo were not giving them any leeway.

Then, in the 5th minute, the breakthrough finally came. Isco found Alvaro Morata with a well-timed pass. Morata collected the ball on the edge of the box and unleashed a terrific shot into the bottom right corner. A fabulous goal that finally broke the deadlock and sent the Santiago Bernabeu into raptures.

Deportivo responded defiantly, winning an indirect free-kick soon after resuming play. They managed to earn a corner, but all their efforts were still falling short of troubling Keylor Navas in the Madrid goal. Real Madrid, buoyed by their goal, looked to extend their lead, maintaining possession and controlling the pace of the match.

Around the 12th minute, a confrontation resulted in Danilo requiring medical treatment due to an injury. Despite the concern, he was able to continue, but Deportivo took the opportunity to substitute Emre Colak with Joselu. Almost immediately, Joselu made an impact. In the 18th minute, he received a pass from Carles Gil and shot from the edge of the area into the top left corner, leveling the match 1-1. His splendid effort revived Deportivo’s hopes.

The game took another dramatic turn in the 20th minute. After a kick-off by Real Madrid, Deportivo struck again. Florin Andone played a fantastic through ball to Joselu, who managed to beat the offside trap and slotted the ball low past Navas. Overnight Joselu had turned the game on its head, putting Deportivo 2-1 up, much to the shock of the Real Madrid faithful.

Zinedine Zidane responded by bringing on Lucas Vazquez for Marco Asensio in the 22nd minute. Real Madrid needed fresh legs and new ideas to overturn the scoreline. Lucas Vazquez’s introduction added pace to the attack, and just a minute later, Real Madrid had a shot on target. However, they had to wait yet again for the equalizer.

Around the 36th minute mark, Real Madrid substituted Isco for Mariano as they chased the game. Mariano's impact was almost instantaneous. In the 39th minute, Lucas Vazquez showcased his skill by delivering a beautifully lofted cross into the box. Mariano capitalized on the opportunity, heading the ball powerfully inside the left post and leveling the game at 2-2. Real Madrid fans were ecstatic, seeing their team claw back into the match.

Tensions were high with the game nearing its end. Both teams committed fouls, winning yellow cards, including cautions for Keylor Navas, Sidnei, and Sergio Ramos. Each side was looking to secure the winner and avoid conceding a late goal.

In the last minutes of the game, Real Madrid surged forward once more. In the 47th minute, Alvaro Morata's header from a cross nearly gave Madrid the lead again, but Przemyslaw Tyton pulled off a fantastic save to keep Deportivo in the game. Nevertheless, Real Madrid sensed that the-winning goal was imminent.

From the resulting corner taken in the 50th minute, Toni Kroos swung in a dangerous cross into the Deportivo penalty area. Sergio Ramos, the Madrid captain notorious for his clutch goals, rose highest and powered a header into the top of the net to make it 3-2. The Deportivo players were left stunned as Real Madrid completed a sensational comeback in dramatic fashion.

As the game entered stoppage time, Real Madrid maintained possession, exchanging long passes and ensuring that Deportivo couldn’t mount another comeback. The final whistle blew, confirming Real Madrid’s 3-2 victory.

In conclusion, this matchup provided high drama and excitement, with Real Madrid emerging victorious in an enthralling contest. The game's ebb and flow encapsulated the unpredictability and excitement of football. Real Madrid's persistence and quality ultimately shone through, turning a potential defeat into a thrilling win for the home fans at Santiago Bernabeu.
